ref: 7736 pattralá ʻ leafy ʼ lex. 2. ʻ *leaflike, thin ʼ (n. ʻ thin sour milk ʼ lex.). [Cf. pattalī -- karōti ʻ beats into thin leaves ʼ Bhpr., pātraṭa -- ʻ thin ʼ lex. and semant. pattrin -- . <-> páttra -- ]
Pk. pattala -- ʻ leafy ʼ, n. ʻ leaf, leaves ʼ;
Ind.) patulu m. ʻ mat made of pieces of wood and reeds ʼ, patüjü f. ʻ mat of leaves or straw ʼ;

lang: Indo-aryan of India proper excluding Kafiri and Dardic
ref: Ind.) patulu m. ʻ mat made of pieces of wood and reeds ʼ, patüjü f. ʻ mat of leaves or straw ʼ;
P. pattal f. ʻ leaf -- platter ʼ;
Ku. pātal ʻ bush ʼ, pātlo m., ˚li f. ʻ plate of leaves sewn together ʼ;
N. pātal ʻ thick clump of bushes ʼ (whence pātale ʻ growing in clumps ʼ in p˚ sisnu ʻ the wild nettle ʼ);
G. pātal f. ʻ leaf -- platter ʼ.
